page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: FARMING FARMING CONTINUES TO BE THE MAINSTAY OF THE COMMUNITY BUT PROVIDES A LIVING FOR CONSIDERABLY FEW PEOPLE THAN IN THE PAST . THE NUMBER OF FARMS RUN AS SINGLE UNITS CONTINUE TO DECLINE AND THERE ARE FEWER FAMILIES ENGAGED IN AGRICULTURE AND LESS EMPLOYED LABOUR . THE EMPHASIS IS MORE ON MIXED FARMING WITH ONLY ONE DAIRY FARM WITH A HERD OF APPROXIMATELY 40 MILKERS . THE PRODUCTION OF BEEF CATTLE FOR FATTENING OR SELLING AS STORES CONTINUE TO BE AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE FARMING SYSTEM WITH A NUMBER OF SUCKLING HERDS . THERE HAS BEEN A TREMENDOUS INCREASE IN THE SHEEP POPULATION . MORE FARMERS ARE MAKING SILAGE FOR WINTER FEEDING RATHER THAN HAY ALTHOUGH HAY IS STILL HARVESTED BY MANY .
